front.title: Flow Transparent Mobility and QoS Support for Pv6-based Wireless Real-time Services

abstract.t: This draft proposes a Mobile IPv6 and RSVP interworking scheme. In this scheme, the underlying mobility support mechanism is required to provide a unique flow identity regardless of node mobility, making node mobility transparent to flow QoS handling mechanisms. Thus QoS signaling delay as well as data packet delays and losses during handoff can be reduced. We also discuss solutions to achieve this scheme which utilizes the new IPv6 flow label. Finally, issues related to security and scalability will also be considered.
